[Spoken]
This is also John Lennon speaking, albeit in a high voice. John put lots of humor in outtakes, and even in full songs, like this one.
“Hark the Angels Come”
The next track on the album is “Let It Be” which was famously disliked by John Lennon to be “too evangelical”
Dig it, dig it
Slang for being into something or liking it.
Dig it, dig it, dig it
This song is actually an excerpt from a longer 15 minute Like A Rolling Stone jam. 4 minutes of it can be seen in the film Let It Be.
Georgie Wood
Wee Georgie Wood was a British actor, who grew to be only 1.45m.
And Doris Day
Successful actress in the 50s and early 60s.
B.B. King
BB King is a famous Blues guitarist.

Like the FBI
 And the CIA
 And the BBC

The Federal Bureau of Investigation,
The Central Intelligence Agency, and
The British Broadcasting Company (respectively).
Matt Busby,

Sir Matt Busby was the legendary manager of Manchester United, most famous for his talented young side known as the “Busby Babes”. Several of them died in the Munich air tragedy.

Busby led Manchester United to the European Cup in 1968, and retired in 1969 shortly after this song was recorded.

Like a rolling stone
 Like a rolling stone
 Like a rolling stone

This is a reference to Like A Rolling Stone, a 1965 song by Bob Dylan. This song was later named the greatest song of all time by Rolling Stone magazine, which takes its name from the song.
